title: Data Structure Visualization Learning Based on the Split-Attention Effect

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming and data structure concepts
context.additional_context: Microlearning design for working learners, considering utilization of non-working hours and ensuring accessibility via personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can explain connected list node diagrams and actual code implementations with over 80% accuracy by synchronizing them.
Learners can practice pointer manipulation processes with over 90% engagement using visualization tools based on the split-attention effect.
Learners can improve data structure learning gaps by at least one level on a three-tier scale through formative assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
